intro: Ipomoea haenkeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other species of morning glories. Ipomoea haenkeana is often found in coastal areas and is known for its rapid growth and ornamental value.
